title: Oregon Caves National Monument & Preserve: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes       There is no fee to enter Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve. Enjoy your visit!   If you plan to visit other parks with an entrance fee, learn more about the America the Beautiful - The National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass series and fee-free days in the national parks. Reservations Limited reservations are available for cave tours here. Arrival 1 hour before your intended cave tour is highly recommended. Fees Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve has no entrance fee, but there is a cave tour fee (expanded amenity). As such, the Interagency Annual Pass does not apply for cave tours. However, the Interagency Access and Senior passes get the cardholder half off (50%) a Discovery cave tour. To enter the caves, the rates are as follows: Discovery Cave Tour $10.00 Adults, ages 16 and over $7.00 Juniors, ages 15 and under Click here for more information.   At times, Oregon Caves may experience technical difficulties with its phone system. On these days, we may not be able to accept credit cards. Please bring cash. We apologize for any inconvenience this causes. Please call (541) 592-2100 ext. 2221 and inform us of when your group will be arriving.   Candlelight Tours (Summer schedule) $10.00 per person, ages 12 and over only. Click here for more information.   Off-Trail Caving Tours (Summer schedule - partial) $45.00 per person, ages 15 and over only. Click here for more information. You must reserve a tour in advance and space is limited to 8 per tour. To make a reservation click here.   Educational Fee Waivers Your education group may qualify for a fee waiver. Learn more about curriculum-based education field trips for school groups during the spring or fall.   National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Passes  For more information about Annual & Lifetime Passes Please Note: Interagency Annual Pass - The National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Annual Pass does not apply to cave tours. Interagency Annual Pass for Active Duty US Military does not apply to cave tours. Interagency Senior Pass or America the Beautiful Access Pass, Golden Age Passport and Golden Access Passport allows only the cardholder to receive a 50% discount on regular priced tours (does not apply towards Off-trail or Candlelight tours). Golden Access and Golden Age Passports are no longer sold. However, these passes will continue to be honored according to the provisions of the pass. As a reminder, tour size is limited to 15 people. Early arrival is recommended.
